intro: Cedrela rehderiana, commonly known as the Honduras mahogany, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae and is characterized by its smooth, aromatic bark and dense, dark-colored wood. The plant typically grows in humid lowland forests and can reach heights of up to 30 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and ovate, while its flowers are small and clustered in panicles. Cedrela rehderiana is valued for its hard, durable wood, which has been historically used in furniture and cabinetry.
